meanings.definition: The state or quality of being recessive.
meanings.sent1: The recessivenesses of her personality made her shy and quiet.
meanings.sent2: The genetic counselor explained the concept of recessivenesses to the expectant parents.
meanings.sent3: Despite her recessivenesses, she always had a twinkle in her eye.
meanings.sent4: The recessivenesses of the old building's architecture gave it a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The recessivenesses of the forest canopy created a cool, shaded retreat.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a genetic trait to be expressed only when inherited from both parents.
meanings.sent1: The doctor discussed the recessivenesses of the trait with the family.
meanings.sent2: In genetics class, we learned about the concept of recessivenesses.
meanings.sent3: The recessivenesses of the gene seemed to play hide and seek in the family tree.
meanings.sent4: The recessivenesses of the trait were like a secret waiting to be uncovered.
meanings.sent5: The recessivenesses of the flower's color only showed in certain lighting conditions.
